rationale: This 8-bar arrangement uses only triads (capped jazz_harmony at 3/10) with no 7th chords or functional progressions. The hihat plays consistently on downbeats with no upbeat syncopation (capped latin_jazz_rhythm at 3/10). The saxophone melody consists of repetitive scale patterns with no variation or development (4/10). All instruments start playing in bar 1 with no progressive build (interplay_space capped at 4/10). The overall feel is generic and lacks the soul, sophistication, and improvisational spirit that defines jazz (4/10). Needs 7th chords, stronger upbeat groove, and proper progressive arrangement.
suggestions: Bar 1: ONLY hihat should play. All other instruments rest.
Bars 2-4: Add snare and bass. Piano and sax still rest.
Bars 5-8: Full ensemble enters with piano 7th chords and memorable sax melody.
Replace ALL piano triads with 7th chords (Cmaj7: C-E-G-B, Dm7: D-F-A-C)
Increase hihat upbeat syncopation to >60% (hit more 'and's, skip more downbeats)
prompt_mutation: Emphasize progressive arrangement structure more strongly. Add quantitative requirements: Bar 1 = hihat ONLY, Bars 2-4 = rhythm section ONLY (no piano/sax), Bars 5-8 = full ensemble. Make it impossible to ignore.
